hero.title: Hi, I'm David Almeida
hero.subtitle: Front-End Developer focused on modern, responsive, and performant experiences.

about.title: About Me
about.description:
I’m a Software Engineer with over 9 years of experience in both front-end and back-end development.

I work with modern technologies such as React, Vue, TypeScript, Node.js, and PHP (Laravel). I’m passionate about clean code, accessibility, and responsive user experiences.

Currently working as a Front-End Developer on large-scale projects using React.js, Next.js, and Vue.js, integrating with REST APIs, GraphQL, and WebSockets.

I love scalable architecture, clean patterns, and collaborative teams.

frontend.title: Front-End Development
frontend.description: Building modern interfaces focused on performance, responsiveness, and UX using Vue.js, React, and Next.js.

fullstack.title: Fullstack Development
fullstack.description: Complete experience with backend using Node.js, Express, and PHP (Laravel), including SQL and NoSQL databases.

uiux.title: UI/UX Design
uiux.description: Support in interface design, usability, and prototyping with Figma, focusing on accessibility and visual consistency.

api.title: API Integration
api.description: Working with REST APIs, GraphQL, and WebSockets for real-time integration and service communication.

devops.title: DevOps & Cloud
devops.description: Automation of deployments and continuous integration using Jenkins, Blue Ocean and GitHub Actions. Experience with AWS services like Lambda, EC2, S3, RDS, Aurora, CloudFront, Route 53, IAM, Amplify, and CodeDeploy Serverless. Setup of efficient pipelines and application monitoring in scalable environments.

resume.title: My Portfolio
resume.description: Responsive portfolio built with Vue 3, Tailwind CSS, multi-language support, and mobile-first design.

trackmall.title: TrackMall
trackmall.description: Commercial space management platform integrated with APIs and real-time dashboards.
trackmall.goal: Led major improvements in system performance and scalability, integrating 3D maps using Three.js for commercial space visualization. Set up CI pipelines with Jenkins and Blue Ocean, implemented unit tests and code quality checks. Reduced cloud costs by optimizing AWS services (RDS, Athena, CloudWatch) and improved database performance through strategic indexing, enhancing client integrations and overall user experience.

bookaboat.title: Book a Boat
bookaboat.description: Boat booking application with search system, filters, interactive map, and admin area.
bookaboat.goal: Led the architecture and development of a full-stack boat rental platform using Next.js and NestJS, designed with SOLID principles and a clean architecture approach. I implemented SSR for better SEO, dynamic map integration for boat locations, and advanced filtering. Backend featured a scalable REST API with JWT authentication, PostgreSQL with Prisma ORM, and modular service layers. CI/CD pipelines were configured using GitHub Actions and Docker, ensuring high code quality and automatic deployment.

vxdoc.title: VXDoc
vxdoc.description: Document management system with digital signature, protocol steps, and JWT authentication.

provider.title: VisioDocX (Provider IT)
provider.description: Integration system combining spreadsheet data and AI with real-time communication via WebSocket and GraphQL in React.
provider.goal: Technical leadership in building a smart solution for spreadsheet data analysis using generative AI, integrating a real-time React interface with GraphQL and WebSocket. Overcame challenges in synchronizing multiple users and the AI while maintaining data consistency and performance. The architecture focused on scalability with Apollo Client, optimized caching, reconnection handling, and offline fallback. As a result, response time was greatly improved and user experience significantly enhanced.

dbc.title: Onboarding Clients (DBC)
dbc.description: Client management system with tech stack upgrade and implementation of unit and end-to-end tests.
dbc.goal: Migrated the React application to version 18 and implemented full test coverage using Cypress and Jest.

helpvino.title: Helpvino
helpvino.description: Wine marketplace with CI/CD automation, test coverage, and full AWS deployment with EC2 and CloudFront.
helpvino.goal: Built CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins and Blue Ocean, modernized the frontend, and led the migration from GitHub Pages to AWS.

controllab.title: ControlLab
controllab.description: Lab systems built from scratch using React, React Native, PHP, Laravel, Java, Kotlin with TDD/BDD practices.
controllab.goal: Architected and developed complex systems from the ground up, applying modern practices and integrating multiple technologies.
